channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023120290
item.description:
Report X-2023120290

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazardous package went up the NC belt and while going up the belt when it was separated and went down the NC 9-1 belt it was dented. No leakage until the package handler grabbed the package and its corrosive contents leaked on the package handler hands. the sort manager has a copy of the ftrack scan page and sds that will be with the red folder. DescribePack: There is a dent and puncture on the hazmat on the top corner where the contents leaked DurationRel: 30 and MitigateEffect: For QA to directly minimalize and excessive shaking of the plastic container

item.title: Report X-2023120478
item.description:
Report X-2023120478

  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed the package wet in unload. Package was placed in a lined tote, in the hazmat cage under the ventilation hood. DescribePack: The closure was loose, there are no seals under the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a lined tote, under ventilation hood in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120222
item.description:
Report X-2023120222

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.title: Report E-2023120216
item.description:
Report E-2023120216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately .5 quart of Prime Urethane - PH 550 Medium Hardener/Activator (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the box container and outside 6 cans and did not impact the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 6 impacted cans with box will be placed into a 10 gallon metal drum and staged in waste are for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120203
item.description:
Report X-2023120203

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was processed 11-27. Package went through the sort for loading and out for delivery. Box made it to van line 400 then noticed the leaking hazmat. Manager was notified as well as personnel. Neutralizer was used to soak up the excess acid on the floor. Hazardous materials were placed inside a hazardous tote and bags. DescribePack: Two caps were off the bottles causing the package to become soiled. One full gallon is empty. Seventy-Five percent of the second bottle has been lost. The location of the spill was near the top of van line 400 near the steps. Suspected mishandling of the package caused the caps to become off the bottles. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer was placed on top of the spill and saturated the liquid. After placing the neutralizer, we placed shredded absorbent pads on the spill. Then shoveled the pile into a hazardous spill. Taken to Hazmat Cage for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120231
item.description:
Report X-2023120231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Undeclared UN2056 in glass bottle inside 4G outer package. Leakage due to breakage. Multiple Class 3 undeclared boxes/bottles/jerricans hidden in shrink wrapped consignment/pallet. Only one leak discovered. all boxes were not opened. Held onsite for FAA inspection.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was reported damaged and then grabbed by QA. DescribePack: 1 gallon container ruptured and leaked from small hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package and contents were placed into hazmat drum with bag and brought to qa area.

item.title: Report X-2023120104
item.description:
Report X-2023120104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found torn open with 1 jug missing the lid. Lid was found cracked. Box was torn open and soaked from leakage. Everything was picked up and placed into a hazmat bag then placed into a hazmat red tote and moved to the QA repack station. DescribePack: Box was found torn in half and soaked. The lid has a crack half way around the side going from top to bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box and contents were paced in hazmat bag and red tote and moved to QA repacking area.

item.title: Report X-2023120057
item.description:
Report X-2023120057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found open and wet upon inspection the jugs had been placed upside down in the box causing and internal leak. the lids where on the bottom of the box opposite of the arrow direction DescribePack: the product was placed in the box upside down. the lids where on the bottom not aligned with the directional arrows on the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed package in hazmat bag then placed in yellow drum for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023120048
item.description:
Report X-2023120048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on the rollers in the load area when a package rolled backwards and knocked the package to the floor.The package landed on it's top causing the handle to compress and crack. As a result the seam underneath the handle split causing the container to leak. DescribePack: The handle cracked underneath at the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was turned upright and placed in a hazmat bag

item.title: Report X-2023111233
item.description:
Report X-2023111233

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in a trailer during the unload process wet and was placed into a lined HazMat tote. DescribePack: The cap of the inner container was loose causing the container to leak and damage the outer container. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was taken out of the trailer and put into a lined HazMat tote and a manger and/or QA was notified about the damage.
